trans-unit.source: Represents a 2-D geometric shape defined by the combination of two <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> objects.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry.GeometryCombineMode%2A> property specifies how the two geometries will be combined.

Note that <xref:System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry> combines the area specified by two geometries, so geometries that do not have area (such as <xref:System.Windows.Media.LineGeometry>) disappear when combined.

Geometries can be combined in several ways: using a <xref:System.Windows.Media.GeometryGroup>, a <xref:System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry>, or the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Geometry.Combine%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Geometry> class.
A <xref:System.Windows.Media.GeometryGroup> creates a composite geometry from one or more <xref:System.Windows.Media.Geometry> objects.
A <xref:System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry> uses a specified boolean operation to combine the area described by two <xref:System.Windows.Media.Geometry> objects.

The static <xref:System.Windows.Media.Geometry.Combine%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Geometry> class behaves in exactly the same manner as the <xref:System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry> object.
Careful thought should be involved when using a <xref:System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry> to perform a union as it can be very CPU-expensive.
In most cases, a <xref:System.Windows.Media.GeometryGroup> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry.AddGeometry%2A> will work better.
Use a <xref:System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry> only when any of the following apply:
The geometric operation is not a union.

Either of the geometries have a <xref:System.Windows.Media.FillRule> value of <xref:System.Windows.Media.FillRule.EvenOdd> and the geometries are self-intersecting (i.e. the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FillRule> actually matters).
Time is not a concern, but space is (for instance, if the geometry is created once and then cached).
Typically, <xref:System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry> produces smaller output than <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry.AddGeometry%2A>.
The resulting geometry will be stroked or used in a path animation and <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry.AddGeometry%2A> does not provide the desired outline.
Freezable Features
A <xref:System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry> is a type of <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object.
For information about <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> features, such as freezing and cloning, see the [Freezable Objects Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/freezable-objects-overview.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry"></xref> class with the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> objects.
The first <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> to combine.
The second <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> to combine.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry"></xref> class with the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> objects and <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry.GeometryCombineMode"></xref>.
The method by which geometry1 and geometry2 are combined.
The first <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> to combine.
The second <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> to combine.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry"></xref> class with the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> objects, <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry.GeometryCombineMode"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry.Transform"></xref>.
The method by which geometry1 and geometry2 are combined.
The first <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> to combine.
The second <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> to combine.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry.Transform"></xref> applied to the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry"></xref>.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref> that specifies the bounding box of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry"></xref> object.
**Note:** This method does not take any pens into account.
If animations are present, the base values of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Geometry> object are used to calculate the bounding box.
The bounding box of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry"></xref>.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property will be `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property was `true.`
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry"></xref> object, making deep copies of this object's current values.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property will be `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property was `true`.
Gets or sets the first <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> object of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry.GeometryCombineMode%2A> property specifies how the two geometries will be combined.

Note that <xref:System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry> combines the area specified by two geometries, so geometries that do not have area (such as <xref:System.Windows.Media.LineGeometry>) disappear when combined.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The first <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> object to combine.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry.Geometry1"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the second <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> object of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry.GeometryCombineMode%2A> property specifies how the two geometries will be combined.

Note that <xref:System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry> combines the area specified by two geometries, so geometries that do not have area (such as <xref:System.Windows.Media.LineGeometry>) disappear when combined.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The second <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> object.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry.Geometry2"></xref> dependency property.

Gets or sets the method by which the two geometries (specified by the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry.Geometry1"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry.Geometry2"></xref> properties) are combined.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The method by which <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry.Geometry1"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry.Geometry2"></xref> are combined.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GeometryCombineMode.Union"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry.GeometryCombineMode"></xref> dependency property.
Gets the area of the filled region.
The computational tolerance of error.
Specifies how the error tolerance will be interpreted.
The area of the filled region of this combined geometry.
Determines whether this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry"></xref> object is empty.
**true** if this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry"></xref> is empty; otherwise, **false**.
Determines whether this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry"></xref> object may have curved segments.
**true** if this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CombinedGeometry"></xref> object may have curved segments; otherwise, **false**.
